intro: Stenotus armerioides var. armerioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf armeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
